summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Logs for August 9-10, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate movements, counts, and staffing issues. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's operations shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death there on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jones
persons.context: Inmate with registration #06178-104. Was scheduled for a treaty transfer which was canceled due to mechanical problems, and was later returned to the institution.

persons.name: Garcia
persons.context: Inmate with registration #79043-054. Placed on the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a 'Code #111' designation during the Day Watch shift.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate with registration #86824-054. Placed on a 'Dry Cell' in the R&D holding cell during the Evening Watch shift and remained there at the end of the log.

persons.name: Bright
persons.context: Inmate with registration #76309-054. Listed on 'w/inmate companion' status (likely suicide watch) during the Morning Watch and was taken off this status during the Day Watch.

persons.context: Inmate with registration #71230-054. Listed on 'w/inmate companion' status (likely suicide watch) throughout all three recorded shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch).

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Inmate Movements
events.description: Routine operations at MCC New York including inmate counts, releases, new admissions, movements between units, and placement of inmates in Special Housing Units (SHU), suicide watch, and dry cells.

events.title: Canceled Treaty Transfer for Inmate Jones
events.description: Inmate Jones's treaty transfer was canceled due to mechanical problems with the flight, and the inmate was returned to the institution.

events.title: Multiple Inmates on Suicide Watch Companion Status
events.description: Several inmates (Bright, Gentile, Ramos, Felix, Williams) were listed as being on 'w/inmate companion' status, which typically indicates suicide watch or close observation.

events.title: Inmate Placed in Dry Cell
events.description: Inmate Fernandez was placed on a 'dry cell' in the R&D holding cell with a staff watch. A dry cell is used to prevent flushing of contraband.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This document is a detailed operations log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 9, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility.
The log shows multiple inmates on suicide watch or 'inmate companion' status (Bright, Gentile, Ramos, Felix, Williams), indicating the facility was managing inmates requiring close observation.

The report notes operational issues including an inoperative Control Center Fire Panel, malfunctioning public address systems preventing PREA announcements, and staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments.
Inmate movements included releases (Booth, Bussey, Cuyler, Ramirez, Reyes), new admissions (Carreon, Lora, Matthews, Mutimura), and a canceled treaty transfer for inmate Jones.
The ending inmate count for the facility was 758, with specific counts for units like SHU (72), 10-South (4), and one inmate (Fernandez) in a dry cell.
